title: Disable picture in picture on YouTube
content:
YouTube does some kind of picture in picture thing when I'm watching a video and navigate to a different page on YT.

Is there a way in Firefox to disable/prevent this behavior? If not, is there some other way to disable/prevent this behavior?

(In Firefox settings, I have "Enable picture-in-picture video controls" unchecked. But I think that is referring to something else.)
creator: enso

title: Efficiently Managing Firefox Updates and Patches in a Data Center with Numerous Machines
content:
Hi everyone,

I'm seeking advice on how to efficiently manage Firefox updates and patches in a data center environment where we have a large number of machines. Manually updating each instance of Firefox is not practical due to the scale and the need to ensure minimal downtime.

Here are a few specific questions I have:

1. Automation Tools:

o What tools or software are recommended for automating Firefox updates across multiple machines in a data center?

o Are there any particular scripts or methods that have worked well for you?

2. Best Practices:

o What are the best practices for scheduling updates to ensure minimal disruption to services?

o How do you handle rollback in case an update causes issues?

3. Security:

o How do you ensure that all instances are patched promptly to avoid security vulnerabilities?

o Are there any specific security measures you take during the update process?

4. Monitoring:

o What methods or tools do you use to monitor the update status across all machines?

o How do you verify that all updates have been applied successfully?

5. Challenges and Solutions:

o What challenges have you encountered when managing Firefox updates in a large-scale environment?

o How did you overcome these challenges?

I'd appreciate detailed insights and examples of how you've tackled this issue in your own data centers. Any tips, tricks, or resources would be incredibly helpful.

Thanks in advance for your help!
creator: luciaonmatteo

title: Optimizing Firefox Performance and Troubleshooting Slowdowns
content:
Hi Firefox Community,

I hope everyone is doing well!

I’ve been experiencing some performance issues with Firefox lately, and I’m looking for advice on how to optimize the browser for better speed and responsiveness. I’ve noticed some slowdowns and occasional lag, and I’d appreciate any tips or solutions.

Here are a few specific areas where I need guidance:

Performance Optimization: What are the best settings or adjustments I can make in Firefox to improve overall performance and speed? Extensions and Add-ons: Are there any extensions or add-ons that could be causing slowdowns? How can I identify and manage extensions that impact performance? Troubleshooting Steps: What troubleshooting steps should I follow if Firefox is running slower than usual? Are there any built-in tools or settings that can help diagnose and fix performance issues? Memory and Resource Management: How can I manage Firefox’s memory and resource usage more effectively to ensure smoother operation? Expectations: Configuration Tips: Please include any specific configuration changes or settings adjustments that could enhance Firefox performance. Extension Management: Share advice on how to identify and manage problematic extensions or add-ons. Troubleshooting Techniques: If you have any step-by-step troubleshooting techniques or tools to recommend, that would be helpful. Resource Management: Tips on how to monitor and manage Firefox’s resource usage effectively would be appreciated. Any help or insights would be greatly appreciated. Click here for further information Thank you in advance for your support!

Best regards, Tylor
creator: treegmb

title: CLOSE TAB in content area context menu.
content:
I have previously been able to include the tab 'Close Tab' item in the #contentAreaContextMenu by adding it to browser.xhtml. This no longer works even though 'Reopen Closed Tab' and 'New Tab' still do. 

     <menuitem id="toolbar-context-openANewTab"                command="cmd_newNavigatorTab"                data-l10n-id="toolbar-context-menu-new-tab"/>      <menuitem id="context_closeTab"                label="Close Tab"                data-lazy-l10n-id="tab-context-close-n-tabs"                data-l10n-args='{"tabCount": 1}'/>      <menuitem id="context_undoCloseTab"                label="Reopen Closed Tab"                data-l10n-id="tab-context-reopen-closed-tabs"                data-l10n-args='{"tabCount": 1}'                observes="History:UndoCloseTab"/>


I was previously using the following which no longer works either. 

       <menuitem id="context_closeTab"                label="Close Tab"                oncommand="BrowserCloseTabOrWindow(event);"/>
